TunableList.name: all_in_one_table_parts
TunableList.description: A list of parts that will be considered dining spots by this zone director. This tuning should be used for objects that are their own seats (like picnic tables) and therefore will be treated incorrectly by the normal dining spot tagging system).

TunableTuple.name: business_chef_employee_type_and_situation
TunableTuple.display: Business Chef Employee Type And Situation
TunableTuple.description: The Business Employee Type of the Chef as well as the list of situations that will be randomly chosen from when we spawn a hired chef.

TunableEnum.name: employee_type
TunableEnum.description: The Business Employee Type for the Chef.

TunableList.name: situation_list
TunableList.description: The list of possible chef situations, chosen at random, for hired chefs to be in.

Tunable.description: A potential chef situation for hired chefs to be in.

TunableTuple.name: business_host_employee_type_and_situation
TunableTuple.display: Business Host Employee Type And Situation
TunableTuple.description: The Business Employee Type of the Host as well as the list of situations that will be randomly chosen from when we spawn a hired host.

TunableEnum.name: employee_type
TunableEnum.description: The Business Employee Type for the Host.

TunableList.name: situation_list
TunableList.description: The list of possible host situations, chosen at random, for hired hosts to be in.

Tunable.description: A potential host situation for hired hosts to be in.

TunableTuple.name: business_waitstaff_employee_type_and_situation
TunableTuple.display: Business Waitstaff Employee Type And Situation
TunableTuple.description: The Business Employee Type of the waitstaff as well as the list of situations that will be randomly chosen from when we spawn a hired waitstaff.

TunableEnum.name: employee_type
TunableEnum.description: The Business Employee Type for the waitstaff.

TunableList.name: situation_list
TunableList.description: The list of possible waitstaff situations, chosen at random, for hired waitstaff to be in.

Tunable.description: A potential waitstaff situation for hired waitstaff to be in.

Tunable.name: customer_situation_interval
Tunable.description: The amount of time, in Sim minutes, between attempts to create new customer situations.

TunableTuple.name: customer_situation_type_curve
TunableTuple.description: When customer situations are being generated, they'll be pulled based on the tuning in this.

TunableTuple.name: desired_sim_count_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to the desired sim count.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: entries
TunableList.description: A list of tuples declaring a relationship between days of the week and desire curves.

TunableTuple.description:
The first value is the day of the week that maps to a desired curve of population by time of the day.
days_of_the_week population_desire_by_time_of_day M,Th,F time_curve_1 W,Sa time_curve_2
By production/design request we do not support multiple population curves for the same day. e.g. if you want something special to occur at noon on a Wednesday, make a unique curve for Wednesday and apply the changes to it.

TunableTuple.name: days_of_the_week
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableList.name: walkby_desire_by_time_of_day
TunableList.display: Walkby Desire By Time Of Day
TunableList.description:
Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that maps to a desired list of population (second column).
The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen.
Given this tuning: hour_of_day desired_situations 6 [(w1, s1), (w2, s2)] 10 [(w1, s2)] 14 [(w2, s5)] 20 [(w9, s0)]
if the current hour is 11, hour_of_day will be 10 and desired is [(w1, s2)]. if the current hour is 19, hour_of_day will be 14 and desired is [(w2, s5)]. if the current hour is 23, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. if the current hour is 2, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. (uses 20 tuning because it is not 6 yet)
The entries will be automatically sorted by time.

TunableTuple.name: desired_walkby_situations
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that expresses a desire to populate the world with a specific number of Sims and associating them with an entry from available weighted situations.

TunableVariant.name: desired_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: The number of Sims desired to be participating in the situation.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: disable_churn
Tunable.description:
If checked, we disable churn for this shift change. That means we only fire the situation on shift change, not in between shifts. So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget.
If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableList.name: weighted_situations
TunableList.description: A weighted list of situations to be used while fulfilling the desired Sim count.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A set of tests that must pass for the situation and weight pair to be available for selection.
*IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableTuple.name: weight_multipliers
TunableTuple.description:
Tunable tested multiplier to apply to weight.
*IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: employee_situation_data
TunableList.description: A mapping of Business Employee Type to the data required by the zone director for starting situations.

TunableTuple.name: Employee_Situation_Data
TunableTuple.description: The situation data, per business employee type, for this zone director.

TunableVariant.name: npc_employee_situation_count
TunableVariant.description: The number of situations to create at an NPC-owned business lot.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The Situation Job for this employee type.

Tunable.name: food_reaction_affordance
Tunable.description: The reaction interaction that gets pushed on Sims when their food is created at the table. This interaction should have the constraints to make sure the Sims is sitting at the table before reacting or they might react from somewhere other than their table.

TunableEnum.name: not_a_table_tag
TunableEnum.description: Any object with this tag will not be considered a table for restaurant purposes. The "is a table" criteria is determine by having one of the parent tags of this venues required objects. This tag can be given to any object that would be otherwise considered a table by this criteria.

Tunable.name: place_all_user_sims_in_same_arrival_situation
Tunable.display: Place All User Sims In Same Arrival Situation
Tunable.description: If this is enabled then all user sims will be placed in the same situation instead of each in their own situation.

Tunable.name: place_travel_companion_in_same_arrival_situation
Tunable.display: Place Travel Companion In Same Arrival Situation
Tunable.description: If this is enabled, the travel companion will put into the same situation with user sims. If this checked, place_all_user_sims_in_same_arrival_situation has to be True as well or there will be unit test error.

TunableVariant.name: travel_companion_arrival_situation
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then Sims that aren't controllable that travel with the users Sims will be placed in the tuned situation on arrival. If place_travel_companion_in_same_arrival_situation is checked, this needs to be disable or there will be unit test error.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If the user invites NPC's to travel with them to this lot then this is the situation that they will be added to.

Tunable.name: user_sim_arrival_situation
Tunable.description: The situation to place all of the Sims from the users household in when they arrive.
